description: Evaluation questions for jni_hello_world - multi-language CMake project with C++/Java/Go integration

questions.name: project_name
questions.question: What is the CMake project name?

questions.name: cmake_version
questions.question: What is the minimum CMake version required?

questions.name: cpp_files_count
questions.question: How many .cpp files are in the src/cpp/ directory?

questions.name: java_files_total
questions.question: How many .java files are in the entire repository?

questions.name: go_files_count
questions.question: How many .go files are in src/go/?

questions.name: add_test_count
questions.question: How many add_test commands are in the CMakeLists.txt?

questions.name: find_package_count
questions.question: How many find_package commands are in the CMakeLists.txt?

questions.name: testing_enabled
questions.question: Is enable_testing() called in this project? (Answer yes or no)

questions.name: cmakelists_lines
questions.question: How many lines are in the CMakeLists.txt file?

questions.name: jar_files_built
questions.question: How many .jar files are built by this project?

questions.name: components_count
questions.question: How many components are built in this repository?

questions.name: jni_hello_world_sources
questions.question: What source files (excluding headers) are used to build the jni_hello_world component? (Provide a list)

questions.name: java_hello_lib_sources
questions.question: What source files are used to build the java_hello_lib component? (Provide a list)

questions.name: custom_function_components
questions.question: Which components are built using custom CMake functions (not standard CMake commands like add_executable or add_jar)? (Provide a list, use Windows artifact names)

questions.name: jni_hello_world_external_packages
questions.question: What external packages does the jni_hello_world component depend on? (Provide a list)

questions.name: test_jni_wrapper_sources
questions.question: What source files are used to build the test_jni_wrapper component? (Provide a list)

questions.name: test_executable_mapping
questions.question: Which component does the test_jni_wrapper_cpp test execute? (use Windows artifact name)

questions.name: junit_test_framework
questions.question: What test framework is used for test_hello_world_java?

questions.name: components_using_jni
questions.question: Which components depend on the JNI external package? (Provide a list, use Windows artifact names)

questions.name: output_artifacts
questions.question: What are the names of all output artifacts produced by this build on Windows? (Provide a list)

questions.name: build_order_independent
questions.question: Which components can be built first because they have zero dependencies on other components in this repository? (Provide a list, use Windows artifact names)

questions.name: jni_hello_world_dependencies
questions.question: List all components that jni_hello_world depends on (use Windows artifact names).

questions.name: parallel_build_analysis
questions.question: Can java_hello_lib and libhello.dll be built in parallel? (Answer yes or no)

questions.name: failure_impact_analysis
questions.question: If libhello.dll fails to build, which other components would also fail on Windows? (Provide a list, use Windows artifact names)

questions.name: language_main_entry_point
questions.question: In which programming language is the main() entry point of the application implemented?

questions.name: language_caller_pattern
questions.question: Which programming language calls Java code in this project?

questions.name: test_frameworks_used
questions.question: What test frameworks are used in this repository? (Provide a list)

questions.name: multi_language_component_count
questions.question: How many different programming languages are used across all buildable components?

questions.name: junit_component_dependency
questions.question: Which component does HelloWorldTest depend on? (use Windows artifact name)

questions.name: custom_cmake_functions
questions.question: How many custom CMake functions are defined in CMakeLists.txt (using function/endfunction keywords)?
